definition: Liu Yu, founder of Song of the Southern dynasties 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], broke away from Eastern Jin in 420, reigned as Emperor Wu of Song 宋武帝[Song4 Wu3 di4]
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
surname Liu
abundant
Liu Yu, founder of Southern dynasty Song 劉宋|刘宋, broke away from Eastern Jin in 420

sentences.english: These measures had certain influences on the development of Buddhism in the time to come.
sentences.chinese: 劉裕的這些舉措，對此後佛教的發展有一定的影響。

sentences.english: The war against Hou-Qin is one important step of Liu Yu's for replacing East-Jin.
sentences.chinese: 北伐後秦是劉裕完成其代晉事業採取的對外措施之一。

definition: Sima Yan (236-290), founding emperor of Jin dynasty 晋 after the Three Kingdoms period, reigned 265-290 as Emperor Wu of Jin 晉武帝
Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing

Sima Zhao (211-265), military general and statesman of Cao Wei 曹魏[Cao2 Wei4]
Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
